origin.haema.vampire.name: Vampire
origin.haema.vampire.description: Though harmed by sunlight, vampires have great strength when in the darkness, provided they have enough blood.
power.haema.vampire.name: Bloodthirsty
power.haema.vampire.description: You do not need food, but instead drink blood to get your nourishment. Drink from mobs with shift+right click - more humanoid mobs give better blood.
power.haema.ritualistic.name: Ritualistic
power.haema.ritualistic.description: Your abilities can be upgraded, and new ones gained, by performing rituals.
power.haema.night_vision.name: Night Vision
power.haema.night_vision.description: Your vision, though dull and unsaturated, is better at picking out details in the dark.
power.haema.vampiric_strength.name: Vampiric Strength
power.haema.vampiric_strength.descriptio: You are weak if you don't have much blood - but as your blood level goes up, you become stronger, faster, and more resistant to damage.
power.haema.dash.name: Vampire Dash
power.haema.dash.description: If your blood level is high enough, you can use a short-range dash ability to teleport around.

bookOfBlood.name: Book Of Blood
bookOfBlood.beginning.blood.title: Finding Vampire Blood
$(item)Vampire Blood/$ can be found in dungeons, temples, or from trading with cleric villagers. It can be used to convert humans, those who are not vampires by origin, into vampires.
bookOfBlood.beginning.injector.title: Crafting an Injector
bookOfBlood.beginning.injector.text.1.te: Once you have $(item)Vampire Blood/$, you need to put it into an $(item)injector/$ - this is the tool that you will use to become a vampire!
bookOfBlood.beginning.becoming.title: Becoming a vampire!
bookOfBlood.beginning.becoming.text.1.te: Becoming a vampire is a dangerous process, so you need $(thing)Strength II/$ to survive it. When you have the $(thing)Strength II/$ effect, use the $(item)Vampire Blood Injector/$ on yourself and become a vampire!
bookOfBlood.surviving.description: How to stay alive as a vampire
bookOfBlood.surviving.nourishment.title: Nourishment
bookOfBlood.surviving.nourishment.text.1: You'll probably notice that your vision is much less saturated when you become a vampire - this is because you don't have enough $(thing)blood/$.
bookOfBlood.surviving.nourishment.text.2: As a vampire, you don't need food any more - your hunger bar is now a blood bar.
bookOfBlood.surviving.nourishment.text.3: You can gain blood by feeding from mobs with $(k:sneak)+$(k:use) - more 'human-like' mobs give better blood. You can feed as often as you like, but be careful - if you feed enough to kill something, $(thing)Vampire Hunters/$ have a chance of noticing you. Be careful feeding from villagers - if they're awake and notice you, they won't be very happy!
bookOfBlood.surviving.storage.title: Blood Storage
You can use $(item)Vampire Blood Injectors/$ and $(item)Empty Vampire Blood Injectors/$ to store blood for another time.
bookOfBlood.surviving.hunters.title: A Warning
bookOfBlood.surviving.hunters.text.1.tex: $(thing)Vampire Hunters/$ were once Illagers, who have turned from attacking villages to defending them from the threat of vampires.
bookOfBlood.surviving.hunters.text.2.tex: They have a chance of noticing when a mob dies from a vampire's feeding; also, villagers will call them to their aid if they notice a vampire feeding on them!
bookOfBlood.surviving.hunters.text.3.tex: They have crossbows, and will use them against you from a distance. They also have wooden swords for up-close fighting, so be careful!
bookOfBlood.surviving.weaknesses.title: Your Weaknesses
Vampires can only be killed by certain things. These are:$(br) - Sunlight$(br) - Lightning$(br) - Drowning$(br) - Dragon Breath$(br) - The Void$(br) - Certain weapons, such as wooden swords$(br) - Attacks with the Smite enchantment
bookOfBlood.surviving.sunlight.title: Sunlight
bookOfBlood.surviving.sunlight.text.1.te: Sunlight is deadly for vampires! In the harsh light of the sun, you'll start to burn.
bookOfBlood.surviving.sunlight.spotlight: Wearing full leather armour will let you stay in the sun for a short time.
bookOfBlood.powers.dash.title: Dash
bookOfBlood.powers.dash.text.1.text: Your $(thing)dash/$ ability is a short-range teleport, usable with $(k:haema.dash).$(br)You can only use your dash when you have 9 or more blood drops.$(br)Upgrading your dash reduces its cooldown.
bookOfBlood.powers.immortality.title: Vampire Immortality
bookOfBlood.powers.immortality.text.1.te: Vampires with this ability can only die to a few things - the sun, weapons with smite, the void, and a few more...
bookOfBlood.powers.invisibility.title: Invisibilty
bookOfBlood.powers.invisibility.text.1.t: With this ability, you can become invisible for short periods of time. Once you've obtained the ability by ritual, trigger it with $(k:sneak).$(br)You can only use invisibility when you have 8 or more blood drops.$(br)Upgrading your invisibility increases how long it lasts for.
bookOfBlood.powers.strength.title: Vampiric Strength
bookOfBlood.powers.strength.text.1.text: Vampires are much stronger and faster in their attacks than mortals - and the more blood they have, the stronger and faster they get!$(br)Upgrading this ability increases the maximum level of Vampiric Strength that you can get.
bookOfBlood.powers.vision.title: Vampire Vision
bookOfBlood.powers.vision.text.1.text: Being creatures of the night, vampires have much better night vision than humans - however, the day might be too bright for them...
bookOfBlood.rituals.description: Learn about arcane rituals that grant you new powers
bookOfBlood.rituals.stone_altar.title: Basic Altar
bookOfBlood.rituals.stone_altar.text.1.t: The $(thing)Basic Altar/$ can do some rituals, and can be made with regular stone bricks.
bookOfBlood.rituals.blackstone_altar.tex: The $(thing)Blackstone Altar/$ is capable of doing more rituals, powered by the souls trapped within its torches...
bookOfBlood.rituals.performing.title: Performing Rituals
bookOfBlood.rituals.performing.text.1.te: Rituals can give you more ability points, which you can use to gain or upgrade abilities.
bookOfBlood.rituals.performing.text.2.te: Rituals are performed by filling the altar's ditch with fluid and dropping in items, then standing on the table block and interacting ($(k:use)) with it.
bookOfBlood.rituals.performing.image.1.t: Right click on the ritual table with the Book of Blood in your hand to view all rituals in the REI recipe viewer.
